Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In agreement with previous observations the Tyr allele appeared to be rare or absent in Asiatic ( Indian , Chinese ) populations .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| Asiatic |
| Indian |
| Chinese |

However, upon further examination, it appears that the terms "Asiatic," "Indian," and "Chinese" in this context refer to populations or ethnicities rather than diseases. Therefore, there are no disease entities in this paragraph.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| Tyr allele |

After reviewing the paragraph again, I found that "Tyr allele" is the only term that could potentially be considered a disease, although it is more accurately described as a genetic variant. Nonetheless, I have presented it as a "Disease" entity in the table below.
